Package me.dessie.dessielib.particleapi.transform

Class ParticleTransform

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.particleapi.transform.ParticleTransform
Direct Known Subclasses:
ParticleRotate, ParticleScale, ParticleTranslate
public abstract class ParticleTransform extends Object
Used to transform ShapedParticle as they are being rendered in the world. This class is used as a baseline for defining these transformations.
See Also:
  • ParticleScale
  • ParticleRotate
  • ParticleTranslate

  • Constructor Details

    • ParticleTransform

      public ParticleTransform(TransformType type, int frames, BiFunction<org.bukkit.Location,Integer,org.bukkit.util.Vector> transform)
      Parameters:
      type - The TransformType of this Transformation.
      frames - Over how many animation frames this transformation will be applied. A "frame" is when the ParticleAnimator renders the Particle. The TransformType will determine how the cycle behaves once the frame cap is reached.
      transform - The transformation function. If you're creating a custom transformation, you can get the result of the function using apply(Location)

  • Method Details

    • apply

      protected org.bukkit.util.Vector apply(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Applies the transformation function onto a Location. You'll call this function in your overriding applyToPoints(Location, List).
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the ShapedParticle
      Returns:
      The Vector that is returned by the Transformation Function.

    • getTransform

      public BiFunction<org.bukkit.Location,Integer,org.bukkit.util.Vector> getTransform()
      Returns:
      The Transformation Function

    • getType

      public TransformType getType()
      Returns:
      The TransformType that is used to control the behavior of the Transformation when the frame count is reached.

    • getFrames

      public int getFrames()
      Returns:
      Over how many animation frames this transformation will be applied.

    • isStatic

      public boolean isStatic()
      Returns:
      If the transformation is static.

    • setType

      public ParticleTransform setType(TransformType type)
      Parameters:
      type - The new TransformType.
      Returns:
      The ParticleTransform instance.

    • setTransform

      public ParticleTransform setTransform(BiFunction<org.bukkit.Location,Integer,org.bukkit.util.Vector> transform)
      Parameters:
      transform - The new transformation function.
      Returns:
      The ParticleTransform instance.

    • applyToPoints

      public abstract void applyToPoints(org.bukkit.Location location, List<org.bukkit.util.Vector> points)
      This method is used to directly apply the transformation function. The location of each Vector can be modified directly. To obtain the transformation function result, use apply(Location).
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the ShapedParticle that is being transformed.
      points - The locations of all the particles that make up the ShapedParticle.
